geom
Class GeometricDistances

java.lang.Object
  geom.GeometricDistances

public class GeometricDistances
extends java.lang.Object

Calculate geometric distances between a given point and a few geometric objects. 

   Written by Davide Bucci, davbucci at tiscali dot it

pointToSegment

public static double pointToSegment(double xa,
                                    double ya,
                                    double xb,
                                    double yb,
                                    double x,
                                    double y)
Calculate the euclidean distance between a point and a segment. Adapted from http://www.vb-helper.com/howto_distance_point_to_line.html

Parameters:
xa - the X coordinate of the starting point of the segment
ya - the Y coordinate of the starting point of the segment
xb - the X coordinate of the ending point of the segment
yb - the Y coordinate of the ending point of the segment
x - the X coordinate of the point
y - the Y coordinate of the point

pointInPolygon

public static boolean pointInPolygon(int npol,
                                     double[] xp,
                                     double[] yp,
                                     double x,
                                     double y)
Tells if a point lies inside a polygon, using the alternance rule adapted from a snippet by Randolph Franklin, in Paul Bourke pages: http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/insidepoly/

Parameters:
npol - number of vertex
xp - vector of x coordinates of vertices
yp - vector of y coordinates of vertices
x - x coordinate of the point
y - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
true if the point lies in the polygon, false otherwise.

pointInEllipse

public static boolean pointInEllipse(double ex,
                                     double ey,
                                     double w,
                                     double h,
                                     double px,
                                     double py)
Tells if a point lies inside an ellipse

Parameters:
ex - x coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
ey - y coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
w - width of the ellipse
h - height of the ellipse
px - x coordinate of the point
py - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
true if the point lies in the ellipse, false otherwise.

pointInEllipse

                                     int ey,
                                     int w,
                                     int h,
                                     int px,
                                     int py)

Parameters:
ex - x coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
ey - y coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
w - width of the ellipse
h - height of the ellipse
px - x coordinate of the point
py - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
true if the point lies in the ellipse, false otherwise.

pointToEllipse

public static double pointToEllipse(double ex,
                                    double ey,
                                    double w,
                                    double h,
                                    double px,
                                    double py)
Give the distance between the given point and the ellipse path. The difference with pointInEllipse is that pointInEllipse gives 0 when the point is inside the ellipse, where here we get the distance with the contour of the ellipse.

Parameters:
ex - x coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
ey - y coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
w - width of the ellipse
h - height of the ellipse
px - x coordinate of the point
py - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
the distance to the contour of the ellipse

pointToEllipse

public static int pointToEllipse(int ex,
                                 int ey,
                                 int w,
                                 int h,
                                 int px,
                                 int py)
Give the distance between the given point and the ellipse path (integer version)

Parameters:
ex - x coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
ey - y coordinate of the top left corner of the ellipse
w - width of the ellipse
h - height of the ellipse
px - x coordinate of the point
py - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
the distance to the contour of the ellipse

pointToRectangle

public static double pointToRectangle(double ex,
                                      double ey,
                                      double w,
                                      double h,
                                      double px,
                                      double py)
Give the distance between the given point and the borders of a rectangle

Parameters:
ex - x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
ey - y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
w - width of the rectangle
h - height of the rectangle
px - x coordinate of the point
py - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
the distance to one of the border of the rectangle

pointToBezier

public static int pointToBezier(int x1,
                                int y1,
                                int x2,
                                int y2,
                                int x3,
                                int y3,
                                int x4,
                                int y4,
                                int px,
                                int py)
Give an approximation of the distance between a point and a Bézier curve. The curve is divided into MAX_BEZIER_SEGMENTS linear pieces and the distance is calculated with each piece. The given distance is the minimum distance found for all pieces. Freely inspired from the original Fidocad method.

Parameters:
x1 - x coordinate of the first control point of the Bézier curve.
y1 - y coordinate of the first control point of the Bézier curve.
x2 - x coordinate of the second control point of the Bézier curve.
y2 - y coordinate of the second control point of the Bézier curve.
x3 - x coordinate of the third control point of the Bézier curve.
y3 - y coordinate of the third control point of the Bézier curve.
x4 - x coordinate of the fourth control point of the Bézier curve.
y4 - y coordinate of the fourth control point of the Bézier curve.
px - x coordinate of the point
py - y coordinate of the point
Returns:
an approximate value of the distance between the given point and the Bézier curve specified by the control points.
